name: 2,3,4,9-tetrahydro-1H-beta-carboline-3-carboxylic acid
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4295

name: 2,3,4,9-tetrahydro-1H-beta-carboline-3-carboxylic acid
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4295
Reason: Starting with indole, which has a melting point around 52°C, we add the effects of other structural features. The carboxylic acid group typically raises the melting point due to its ability to form strong intermolecular hydrogen bonds; this can contribute around +150°C to the melting point. The cyclic structure in the tetrohydro moiety with the nitrogen introduces ring strain and rigidness, which can contribute around +50°C. Additionally, the presence of the nitrogen in the ring structure can allow for hydrogen bonding, potentially adding +20°C. Finally, the saturation of the carboline part adds to a more rigid and less entropic structure, contributing to an increase of around +30°C.
